website_summaries.verdict: A great reference book where you can quickly look up a specific command or library.
pros: Lists out most of the important components, libraries, methods, and programming strategies of the Java language
Easy to navigate to find specific information quickly
cons: Not beginner-friendly for readers looking for a step-by-step guide book on starting to program in the language

customer_reviews.title: Here's how to download source code examples
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb book, as are all of Schildt's. It is a huge defect that Amazon.Oracle/and McGraw Hill (the publisher) go to no effort to help readers download source code examples. I finally found it at  Thanks to the response below.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. White

customer_reviews.title: A must have reference book for Java 9 developers.
customer_reviews.text: Herbert Schildt is one of the best authors for Java, this updated edition is a must-have for any Java developer. A great reference book that covers the new Java 9 recently released.
customer_reviews.author: Tomcat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Java reference ( at least until Java 9 )
customer_reviews.text: This is literally a Java manual for learning this amazing language. The reference will help you through your career. I currently use Java 8 and this book just helps me with anything. I mean, even an expert is going to find things in this book he/she didn't know. Simply put: an excellent reference book that has the basics of almost everything in the Java library.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Matute

customer_reviews.title: Should be 5 stars except for the version of kindle ...
customer_reviews.text: Should be 5 stars except for the version of kindle: the exaples are so small and lightly printed, I bought a x4 magnifier to deal with this problem. The book is very well written ...
customer_reviews.author: Hao N. Le

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: This is a great resource to have when learning Java. I found it to be an awesome add-on to my course textbooks. When I couldn't find the answer to my questions in my textbooks, I was able to look them up in this book. I love the detail. There were things I didn't know I did not know. It is definitely worth the money. I ended up getting an A in my Java class.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B

customer_reviews.title: Great book for someone who wants to have some extensive ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book for someone who wants to have some extensive knowledge on the subject of java. The collections framework piece as well as the applications into Java's GUI make this a solid piece to have around as a reference
customer_reviews.author: Trajon

customer_reviews.title: Chapters are well defined.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book, just one chapter reading the Generics with simple and easy to understand. Flow of information is well laid out and I would even suggest this book for total Java beginner as a course reference book.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lam

customer_reviews.title: Great book for experienced programmers
customer_reviews.text: I had taken one java programming course many years ago and wanted a book I could read though and get a good grasp of the language. This book has exceeded my expectations in doing that.
customer_reviews.author: dave schmid

customer_reviews.title: Great Book, but one request...
customer_reviews.text: I love the book. It gives a nice sequential explanation of what goes on. However, a hardback version of this book would be nice. My book ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Reference, not for absolute beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book if you have some experience with Java and are looking to have a handy desktop reference available. New learners or novices may find the text overwhelming, as the book is quite long and the code examples are succinct and are only meant to provide a simple demonstration or "proof of concept" for the discussion of the topic.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ceravolo

customer_reviews.title: Used as reference in College course along with textbook
customer_reviews.text: Great reference guide for a student to use along with their textbook. Information contained is thorough and can help clear any questions you may have that your textbook does not make clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: great examples and very well written. The reading is easy and the application from book to programming is an easy transition.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin CTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nobody signed for this, who is RORIE???
customer_reviews.text: Book came with a broken spine. So there's a page where you can see the string and (lack) of glue. Works fine for now, but because of this, this book will definitely rip in half from repeatedly opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Dorick

customer_reviews.title: One heck of a Java 9 reference book.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent reference work. Its no-nonsense to-the-point examples were great help. I wish this edition much success, such as solid sales because it sure deserves it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Soto

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: As always, new Java9 concepts explained. I've been buying 'Complete Reference' since Java2. Not for beginners though.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best Java reference I've found.
customer_reviews.text: If I could only have one Java reference book then this would be it. Covers the basics and then some. Explanations are readable and clear. The index is good. All in all, one of the best reference books I've ever used. Based on an excellent experience with the Kindle version I decided to also get the paperback.
customer_reviews.author: Sonarman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good book. It was a little large (I wish it was a multivolume book).
customer_reviews.author: JAMES P BRECKEL

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good reference book, wouldn’t recommend for someone new to java.
customer_reviews.author: KevinMan

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Very good book with in-depth explanations about most topics required for aspiring Java devs (and even for experienced ones when trying to learn more about a feature). Language is clear and concise, Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Missing pages
customer_reviews.text: Our copy of this book is missing pages 191-222. My son loves the book but needed these pages for a class project.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: The complete package for any skill level
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a month, a great refresher for me
customer_reviews.author: Maximiliano M.

customer_reviews.title: Very complete
customer_reviews.text: - detailed - with examples - good to start with Java for more advanced people
customer_reviews.author: Michal

customer_reviews.title: Ver Big Book
customer_reviews.text: I am longing to see new books, but who know they are so big big big books. I really crying. However, I love them. Books are delivery on time.
customer_reviews.author: Kanit Ph

customer_reviews.title: SHIPMENT
customer_reviews.text: It's very fast to get my ordered book. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Eric LI

customer_reviews.title: Can't download examples.
customer_reviews.text: To download examples, you need to disable add blocking and also go through other foolishness. It would be nice if you could simply download the examples, without having to manually type them out.
customer_reviews.author: James Everitt

customer_reviews.title: all what i have bought did not take long time like this book
customer_reviews.text: i bought too many things. all what i have bought did not take long time like this book.
customer_reviews.author: Rayan

customer_reviews.title: Very good book, I think will be good also for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good book , I think will be good also for newbie to java . The only problem with kindle version is that , can't translate to other language than english even though that there is translate plug in for chrome\firefox , it wont work with kindle cloud the copy option is absolutly canceled
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Java: The Complete Reference, Tenth Edition (Complete Reference Series)
